alert.note: Alert for Gove; Greeley; Logan; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 25 at 5:44PM CST until December 27 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow, blowing snow and strong northwest winds. Total snow accumulations up to 3 inches. Northwest winds sustained at 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * WHERE...Wallace, Logan, Gove, Greeley and Wichita Counties. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...A prolonged period of hazardous travel conditions associated with occasional snow, strong northwesterly winds and blowing snow. Travel will become difficult across the advisory area tonight and Tuesday. Road closures are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will increase in coverage and intensity late this evening and overnight. Northwest winds will also strengthen this evening and overnight, strongest in eastern Colorado and adjacent Kansas border counties where sustained winds may reach 30 to 45 mph and gusts up to 65 mph are possible. Wind of this magnitude may result in power outages and property damage. Outdoor holiday decorations are especially vulnerable.
info.instruction: Near blizzard conditions are expected within the advisory area. Travel is not advised. If you absolutely must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
